lines.content: Welcome to **Blarney**, your friendly to-do list assistant! This app helps you manage your tasks, deadlines, and events efficiently. Below is a user guide to help you navigate through the available commands.
- Add, mark, unmark, and delete tasks.
- Schedule events with start and end times.
- List all current tasks and events.
To add a new task to your to-do list:
To mark a task as completed:
I have marked task 1 as done:
### Unmark a Task as Not Done
I have marked task 1 as not done yet:
To remove a task from the list:
I have deleted task 1: [T][ ] Buy groceries
To schedule an event with a start and end time:
To add a task with a deadline:
Added: [D][ ] Homework (due by: 01-01-2026 12:29), 300 days and 7 hours remaining
To view all current tasks and events:
2. [D][ ] Homework (due by: 01-01-2026 12:29), 300 days and 7 hours remaining
- **[X]** inside brackets means the task is completed.
- **[ ]** inside brackets means the task is pending.
Blarney is here to make your life easier by keeping track of your tasks and schedule. Have fun staying organized!

Welcome to **Blarney**, your friendly to-do list assistant! This app helps you manage your tasks, deadlines, and events efficiently. Below is a user guide to help you navigate through the available commands.
- Add, mark, unmark, and delete tasks.
- Schedule events with start and end times.
- List all current tasks and events.
To add a new task to your to-do list:
To mark a task as completed:
I have marked task 1 as done:
### Unmark a Task as Not Done

To remove a task from the list:

To schedule an event with a start and end time:

To view all current tasks and events:

- **[X]** inside brackets means the task is completed.
- **[ ]** inside brackets means the task is pending.
Blarney is here to make your life easier by keeping track of your tasks and schedule. Have fun staying organized!
* The {@code Blarney} class is the main entry point for the task management application.
* It initializes the task list, loads previous task history, and continuously processes user commands
* until the user issues the "bye" command to exit.
* The main method that starts the application.
* It initializes the task list, loads saved data, and continuously listens for user commands.

System.out.println("Available Commands:\n" + "todo <task-to-be-added>, mark <index>, unmark <index>, list, bye");
System.out.println("event <task-to-be-added> -from <begin (in dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm)> -to <end (in dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm)> eg event x -from 01-01-2026 12:29 -to 01-01-2026 13:29");
System.out.println("deadline <task-to-be-added> -by <deadline in dd-MM-yyyy HH:mm> eg deadline x -by 01-01-2026 12:29");
// End loop if 'bye' command was given

* The {@code Command} class serves as an abstract base for all command types.
* It provides a method for executing commands while handling exceptions.
* Executes the command while handling potential exceptions.
* @param tasks The {@code TaskList} on which the command operates.
* @return {@code true} if execution is successful, {@code false} if an exception occurs.
return true; // Return true if no exceptions occur
return false; // Return false if an exception is thrown
* Executes the specific command logic, implemented in subclasses.
* @param tasks The {@code TaskList} to operate on.
* @throws BlarneyException If an application-specific error occurs.
* @throws IOException If an input/output error occurs.
protected abstract void runCommand(TaskList tasks) throws BlarneyException, IOException;
* The {@code CommandParser} class is responsible for parsing user input into specific command objects.

* @return A {@code Command} object corresponding to the parsed input.

public BlarneyException(String message, Throwable cause) { super("error occured: " + message, cause); }
public BlarneyException(Throwable cause) { super("error occured: ", cause); }
